availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G. Whitsell (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Georgia native. Son of George Whitsell. Married to Marjorie "Mary" F. Crews Whitsell in Henderson County, Kentucky, on June 5, 1851. Father of George W. Whitsell, John P. Whitsell, James M. Whitsell, and Marjorie E. Whitsell. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 151A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 732.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 616.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 210B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film #000576460, p. 122.
